moves.1. e4 c5 2. Ne2 d6: I was glad, with this reply. I was slayed twice now, after 2. ... Nf6, 3. Nbc3... I still have to work on that... Could Paul Keres be wrong?
moves.3. d4: Had I been a true hero, I would have played 3. Nbc3 Nf6 4. d4, but I was cured for a while...
moves.3... cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6: So we're back at the straight Sicilian. Here comes Nimzowitsch... 4. ... g6, is still an option, here... This place, is were we learn the true ropes...
moves.6. Bc4: 6. Be2 g6 7. 0-0 Bg7 didn't appeal to me...
moves.6... e6: I was fearing 6. ... b5 7. Bb3 b4, so I was relieved...
moves.7... Be7: Another relief. 7. ... b5 8. Bd3 e5 9. Nf3 b4 10. Ne2, loses a lot of tempo...
moves.8. Qf3: The best, I could think of... Black has to clear up his development...
moves.8... O-O 9. Bb3 Nc6 10. Be3 Bd7 11. Rfd1: Probably not best. I disliked 11. Rad1 Qc7 12. Rfe1 Ne5 13. Qg3... 11. Nxc6 leads to nothing...
moves.11... Ne5: At least, 11. ... Nxd4 12. Rxd4, doesn't work for black...
moves.12. Qh3 Rc8 13. Bf4: I decided to reject 13. a3 Rxc3! 14. bxc3 Nxe4, for obvious reasons...
moves.13... Neg4: Now, Rxc3 is met by Qxc3...
moves.14. Be3: 14. Bc1 d5 (or Qa5) did not strike my fancy...
moves.14... Qa5: Completing development, and threatening Rxc3... The position is dead equal... Was I proud? Yes...
moves.15. Nde2: 15. Bd2 is playing backwards, I hate that...
Prince Vlad - poses as a vampire - was not pleased, at this stage... His Unholy-Ness had reached nothing against mere me, 100 points below Him... He was urging for my blood...
moves.18... Nd7: My best guess was 18. ... b5 19. a3 a5! 20. Nf4... 18. ... Nd7 is relentless, and best...
moves.19. f4: Probably the last opportunity, to stir up some dust... 19. ... Qh5 seems fine for black, with a dead equal position...
moves.21... Rfe8 22. Kg2 Qxe3: Who am I, to call this inaccurate? This was the least of my fears...
moves.25. a3 a5 26. Rd2 b4 27. axb4 axb4 28. N: Plausible. I still think, Kf8 diminishes drawing chances for white...
moves.31. Rb3: No fear for e4+, Kg2... 31. fxe5 Bg5! looked bad...
moves.31... Rcb8: 31. ... Rc4 32. c3 etc. is dead draw, and probably better for white...
moves.32. c3: Maybe not best. I did not see much, in 32. h3 g5/Bf6, nor 32. g4 fxg4+ 33. Kxg4 Bf6...
moves.32... bxc3 33. Rxb8 Rxb8 34. bxc3 Kf7: 34. ... e4+ 35. Ke3 Bd8 36. Ra2 Bb6+ 37. Nd4, also closes a draw...
moves.35. g4: Now it is draw, or die for black... 35. ... fxg4 36. Kxg4, is very unclear for black...
moves.35... g6: Draw offer from black accepted... White has nothing, but so does black... To me, this draw meant a lot...
